item.title: 盎格鲁集团开始与银行商谈德比尔斯首次公开募股的可能性
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，英美资源集团（Anglo American Plc）已开始与银行就旗下戴比尔斯钻石公司（De Beers）上市事宜进行初步谈判，该公司正寻求推进其彻底重组的最后也是最困难的部分。【原文：Anglo American Plc has begun initial talks with banks about listing its De Beers diamond unit, according to people familiar with the matter, as the company looks to move ahead with the final and most difficult piece of its radical restructuring.】

item.title: 英国央行关注的英国薪酬数据遭经济学家质疑
item.description: 经济学家对英国官方数据的准确性提出了新的质疑，他们警告说，首次在劳动力市场数据中出现的问题 "只是冰山一角"。【原文：Fresh doubts over the accuracy of Britain’s official data have been raised by economists, who warned that the problems first seen in the labor market figures are “just the tip of the iceberg.”】

item.title: 首席执行官称，特拉菲古拉公司在蒙古的 11 亿美元欺诈案 "令人惭愧
item.description: 特拉菲古拉集团（Trafigura Group）在蒙古涉嫌多年欺诈，损失 11 亿美元，这家贸易巨头的新任首席执行官在首次就丑闻发表公开评论时表示，这是一次 "令人惭愧的经历"。【原文：Trafigura Group’s $1.1 billion loss in a suspected multi-year fraud in Mongolia was a “humbling experience,” the trading giant’s new chief said in his first public comments on the scandal.】

item.title: 埃塞俄比亚将关键利率维持在 15%，以抑制高通胀率
item.description: 埃塞俄比亚的货币政策制定者将基准利率维持在 15%，以抑制高企的通货膨胀。【原文：Ethiopian monetary policymakers kept the benchmark interest rate at 15% to curb elevated inflation.】

item.title: 华尔街认为股市暴跌将结束，而欧洲竞争对手却并不确定
item.description: 在对股市的看法上，地域鸿沟正在扩大，欧洲银行比普遍乐观的美国银行更持怀疑态度。【原文：There’s a geographical divide growing in views of the stock market, with European banks more skeptical than their generally sanguine US rivals.】

item.title: 陷入困境的学院将校长住宅的使用权交给债券持有人
item.description: 宾夕法尼亚州的一所私立天主教大学拉罗什大学（La Roche University）正在向债券持有人提供校长住宅的抵押贷款作为额外保护。【原文：La Roche University, a private Catholic university in Pennsylvania, is giving bondholders a mortgage on the college president’s home as extra protection.】

item.title: 德国税务交易案中五名银行家必须接受审判
item.description: 在法兰克福上诉法院推翻了一项撤销案件的裁决之后，五名德国前银行家必须就他们参与二十多年前德国储蓄银行（Deutsche Pfandbrief）Cum-Cum 税收交易一事接受审判。【原文：Five German ex-bankers must stand trial over their involvement in Cum-Cum tax deals struck more than twenty years ago at Deutsche Pfandbrief after a Frankfurt appeals court overturned a decision throwing out the case.】

item.title: 特朗普寻找额外数万亿美元的途径之一
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 特朗普停止资助哥伦比亚大学引来学术联盟起诉
item.description: 两个教育工会就特朗普政府扣留哥伦比亚大学 4 亿美元联邦资金一事提起诉讼，称此举是限制校园学术独立和言论自由的非法企图。【原文：Two educational unions sued the Trump administration over its withholding of $400 million in federal funding from Columbia University, calling the move an illegal attempt to limit academic independence and free speech on campus.】

item.title: 财政部长离职迫使哥伦比亚央行维持利率不变
item.description: 在财政部长上任仅三个月就意外离职后，分析人士认为哥伦比亚央行在下次会议上放弃降息想法的可能性增大。【原文：Analysts see increased odds that Colombia’s central bank will ditch the idea of an interest-rate cut at its next meeting in the wake of the finance’s minister surprise exit just three months into the job.】

item.title: 帆点科技在科技行业波动中面临盈利考验
item.description: SailPoint 公司在科技行业动荡之际重新进入公开市场，但投资者希望其即将公布的业绩能帮助公司扭转颓势。【原文：SailPoint Inc. re-entered the public market at a turbulent time for the technology sector, but investors are hoping its upcoming results can help right the ship.】

item.title: 克罗格因 246 亿美元交易失败遭 Albertsons 起诉
item.description: 克罗格公司（Kroger Co.）正在反击阿尔伯森公司（Albertsons Cos.【原文：Kroger Co. is fighting back against a lawsuit brought by Albertsons Cos. over its failed $24.6 billion takeover of the rival grocery chain, escalating a dispute that began after US antitrust enforcers succeeded in blocking the deal last year.】

item.title: 武伊契奇说，没有欧元的波兰仍依赖欧洲央行
item.description: 一位理事会成员表示，波兰是加入还是退出欧元区取决于欧洲中央银行的决定。【原文：Euro holdout Poland is dependent on decisions taken by the European Central Bank whether it joins the single currency region or stays out, a Governing Council member said.】

item.title: 穆迪称美国财政实力将进一步减弱
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）表示，美国的财政实力陷入了多年的滑坡，而且在 2023 年底美国的主权评级展望被定为负面后 "进一步恶化"。【原文：The fiscal strength of the United States is stuck in a multi-year slide and “has deteriorated further” after the country’s sovereign rating received a negative outlook in late 2023, Moody’s Ratings said.】

item.title: 小额贷款银行寻求财政部和特朗普团队支持以保留税收优惠
item.description: 迄今为止，一群公共财政银行家的注意力主要集中在国会，而现在他们正向特朗普政府伸出橄榄枝，为保持州和地方政府债务免税提出自己的理由。【原文：A group of public finance bankers, who have so far largely focused their attention on Congress, are now reaching out to the Trump administration to make their case for keeping state and local government debt tax free.】

item.title: 南非银行称今年南非经济增长可能翻三番
item.description: Absa Group Ltd.的分析师认为，得益于支出和投资的增加，南非在 2025 年的增长势头将大为改观，尽管与美国关系的降温可能会使前景黯淡。【原文：South Africa looks set for much better growth in 2025 thanks to increased spending and investment, according to analysts at Absa Group Ltd., though a cooling of relations with the US may dim the outlook.】

item.title: 美元遭遇 2023 年以来最糟糕的一个月，看涨押注退却
item.description: 由于美国经济扩张受到唐纳德-特朗普总统关税政策的威胁，美元将迎来一年多来最糟糕的一个月。【原文：The dollar is headed for its worst month in over a year as US economic expansion is threatened by President Donald Trump’s tariff policies.】

item.title: Ticketmaster 可能因 "白金 "绿洲座位而触犯英国法律
item.description: 伦敦的监管机构称，Ticketmaster 在未告知公众其定价计划的情况下，以其他座位 2.5 倍的价格出售绿洲音乐会的部分门票，这可能违反了英国法律。【原文：Ticketmaster may have broken UK law by selling some Oasis concert tickets for 2.5 times what it charged for other seats without informing the public of its pricing plans, regulators in London said.】

item.title: 沙特支持的石油交易所首次在场外交易平台进行交易
item.description: 沙特支持的阿曼石油期货交易所称，一个新的场外交易平台允许客户进行各种原油的实物货物交易，这是该交易所提供地区基准的努力的一部分。【原文：The Saudi-backed exchange for Oman oil futures said a new over-the-counter platform allowing customers to trade physical cargoes of various crudes saw its first trade, part of an effort to help bolster the bourse’s aim to provide a regional benchmark.】

item.title: 过去十年，壳牌交易商从未在任何季度亏损过
item.description: 壳牌公司首席执行官瓦埃勒-萨万（Wael Sawan）说，壳牌公司庞大的内部贸易业务（包括石油、天然气和电力）在过去十年中没有一个季度出现亏损。【原文：Shell Plc’s sprawling in-house trading operation — which includes oil, natural gas and electricity — hasn’t lost money during a single quarter over the last decade, said Chief Executive Officer Wael Sawan.】

item.title: 从经济角度看，上大学还值得吗？
item.description:
是的—但它的最大受益者已经发生了变化。【原文：

Yes—but who it benefits most has changed.

】

item.title: CME 在 24 小时交易行动中测试谷歌区块链技术
item.description: 美国芝加哥商品交易所集团正在测试谷歌云（Google Cloud）的区块链技术，以期在全球转向全天候交易的过程中改善市场基础设施。【原文：CME Group Inc. is testing Google Cloud’s blockchain technology as it seeks to improve market infrastructure amid the global shift toward round-the-clock trading.】

item.title: 卡尼称加拿大希望与特朗普 "认真对待 "贸易谈判
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）表示，他的内阁部长们正在与白宫官员接触，希望就贸易问题进行 "严肃 "的谈判，因为美国的贸易伙伴们正在为唐纳德-特朗普总统的下一轮关税大棒做好准备。【原文：Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said his top cabinet ministers are in contact with White House officials and want to have “serious” negotiations about trade, as US trading partners brace for President Donald Trump’s next barrage of tariffs.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯称欧洲汽车制造商过于依赖美国和中国技术
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰集团（Mercedes-Benz Group AG）的一位高管表示，欧洲在计算机硬件和云服务方面对美国和中国的依赖性使其汽车产业面临风险，因为汽车越来越依赖人工智能。【原文：Europe’s dependency on the US and China for computer hardware and cloud services puts its car industry at risk as vehicles become reliant on artificial intelligence, a Mercedes-Benz Group AG executive said.】

item.title: DeepSeek 大获成功后，中国向全球提供大量人工智能模型
item.description: DeepSeek 不仅向人工智能行业展示了无需花费数十亿美元就能构建人工智能。它点燃了沉寂已久的中国科技产业；现在，从 OpenAI 公司到 Nvidia 公司等西方公司都可能为此付出代价。【原文：DeepSeek did more than just show the AI industry you don’t have to spend billions to build artificial intelligence. It fired up a long-dormant Chinese tech industry — and now Western names from OpenAI Inc. to Nvidia Corp. may pay the price.】

item.title: 特朗普的加密货币项目计划提供追踪美元的稳定币
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的加密货币项目世界自由金融公司（World Liberty Financial）表示，它计划推出一种可与美元一兑一的稳定币，这是在特朗普政府支持支撑大多数加密货币交易的数字代币之际宣布的。【原文：President Donald Trump’s crypto project World Liberty Financial said it plans to launch a stablecoin redeemable one-for-one with the dollar, an announcement that comes as his administration throws its support behind the digital tokens that underpin most crypto transactions.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）发出推迟新协议谈判的信号，塞内加尔欧洲债券下跌
item.description: 塞内加尔美元债券周二下跌，因为国际货币基金组织的一位官员称，由于该组织正在评估上届政府对政府债务规模的错误陈述，新贷款计划的谈判可能会被推迟。【原文：Senegal dollar bonds fell on Tuesday after an International Monetary Fund official said talks on a new lending program may be delayed as it assesses the previous administration’s misstatements about the size of the government’s debt.】

item.title: 嘉能可削减煤炭产量以阻止价格长期下滑
item.description: 全球最大的煤炭运输商嘉能可集团（Glencore Plc）表示，将削减煤炭生产计划，以阻止煤炭价格的长期暴跌。【原文：Glencore Plc said it’s cutting planned coal production as the world’s biggest shipper of the dirtiest fuel looks to halt a prolonged collapse in prices.】

item.title: 葡萄牙 NOS 将在激烈竞争中更换首席财务官
item.description: 在葡萄牙电信公司的第一大股东未能提议首席财务官 Jose Koch Ferreira 连任之后，NOS SGPS 很可能会更换这位首席财务官。【原文：NOS SGPS will likely replace Chief Financial Officer Jose Koch Ferreira after the Portuguese telecommunications company’s top shareholder failed to propose the executive for a new term.】

item.title: 美国称，俄罗斯和乌克兰认为不尽如人意的停火比持续战争更糟糕
item.description: 根据美国情报界的一项评估，俄罗斯和乌克兰可能更有动力延长三年的冲突，而不是匆忙达成解决方案，这与唐纳德-特朗普总统迅速结束三年冲突的承诺相冲突。【原文：Russia and Ukraine may see a greater incentive to prolong the three-year conflict instead of rushing into a settlement, according to an assessment by the US intelligence community that clashes with President Donald Trump’s pledges for a rapid end to the three-year conflict.】
